text.p: These are the leading stories in the Algerian press on Saturday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Fourteen civilians killed in four attacks in Tiaret, Bou-Saada, Ain Defla, Tlemcen regions. Among the dead were four girls and two young shepherds.

- President Liamine Zeroual, addressing a police meeting in Algiers, says "terrorism would not have been able to develop and evolve if it was not for its connection with drug trafficking, the use of false documents, corruption and other crimes."
- The government on Saturday presents its programme before the National Assembly (lower house), a first test for the cabinet led by Prime Minister Ahmed Ouyahia.
- Local election watchdog, the National Committee to supervise the elections, adopts its internal rules.
